scenarios.title: Police asking for license / papers
scenarios.what_this_means: The officer is conducting a routine document check to verify your eligibility to drive.
when_it_is_valid: If you are driving a vehicle on a public road.
Uniformed officer (constable or above) can ask.
what_you_can_say: I have them on DigiLocker, let me show you.
what_not_to_say: Why are you stopping me? (Avoid starting with aggression)
I know my rights, you can't check me.
scenarios.what_happens_next: They will verify the validity. If everything is clear, you will be allowed to proceed immediately.
scenarios.common_misconception: People think they can refuse to show ID without a reason. Under MV Act, you MUST show documents on demand.

scenarios.title: Police taking your keys
scenarios.what_this_means: The officer is trying to immobilize your vehicle, possibly to prevent you from fleeing.
what_you_can_say: Sir, I am not running away. Please do not take my keys.
I am cooperating with the check, removing keys is unnecessary.
what_not_to_say: How dare you touch my bike!
I will record you (Saying it aggressively escalates).
scenarios.what_happens_next: If you stay calm, they usually return keys once you start showing documents. If they persist, you can file a complaint later.
scenarios.common_misconception: Police have a right to seize keys to stop traffic offenders. (They do not).
scenarios.source_category: police conduct / No provision in MV Act

scenarios.title: Jumping a Red Light
scenarios.what_this_means: You are being accused of a traffic violation (Signal Jump).
when_it_is_valid: If you crossed the stop line after the signal turned red.
what_you_can_say: I apologize if I made a mistake.
Please issue the official challan, I will pay it.
what_not_to_say: Tu jaanta nahi mera baap kaun hai.
scenarios.what_happens_next: They will ask for your License to issue a Challan. You can pay online or in court.
scenarios.common_misconception: You can 'settle' it on the spot with cash. (This is bribery).
